intro: Hieracium obscurisquamum, commonly known as the dark-squamate hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with dense, glandular hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium obscurisquamum is often found in low nutrient soils and can be an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
